options.text: "Fix your soul on this!" exclaims Ziggy, sporting glittery shoes and extravagant makeup. "There are billions of stars, planets, and things to explore above our heads! Surely the Creator that made all the stuff up there intended for us to marvel at it, not only from a distance, but with our own hands and feet! What use is a gift that we refuse to understand? @@NAME@@ must aid @@FAITH@@ to become a truly interplanetary religion; we can witness to the East Lebatuckese and Dàguó astronauts, and whoever else might be listening. I can't wait for the moon to become part of my diocese."
options.result: the holiest shrine in @@FAITH@@ is on another world

options.text: "Absolutely not," frets your Minister of Repeating the Past, @@RANDOM_NAME@@. "Don't you know how this ends? One nation decides they need to visit the moon for ideological reasons, and suddenly every nation does! We can't afford to be drawn into a space race with nations like Dàguó or East Lebatuck. Besides, there are plenty of earthly problems to solve before we deal with the heavenly ones."
options.result: religious fanatics complain of being held down by the earth's gravitational field

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: irreverence towards religion
policiesAndNotabilities.name: irreverence towards religion

options.text: "I agree," pipes in your paranoid military advisor. "We can't allow the past to repeat itself. So when we send these devotees to the moon, they must be equipped with the best weaponry and escorted by the best military force that we can afford. There are several nations and radical cults that would be content to blow us out of the sky before we reach the moon. A good offense is the best defense."
options.result: military chaplains grow frustrated with their long commutes

options.text: "We can't have special-interest groups blasting off the planet whenever they feel like it," declares @@RANDOM_NAME@@, glaring disdainfully at Ziggy's outfit. "But it might not be a bad idea to have an official @@DEMONYM_ADJECTIVE@@ Astronaut Corps. With a program carefully run by the government, we can ensure that our space travellers have no ideological loyalty except to our proud @@TYPE@@."
options.result: being a member of the glee club disqualifies @@DEMONYMNOUNPLURAL@@ from space travel

options.text: "This all seems rather foreboding," stammers agoraphobic protester Dana Bautista. "If the Divine had wanted us to visit space, why is it so dark and inhospitable? There's nothing up there but creepy spiders from Mars. We have shown remarkable foresight in forbidding unholy flying machines from these lands. Do not yield to the temptation of these rockets." [[color=red]Airplanes are illegal[/color]]
options.result: above @@NAME@@ there is only sky and the fear of the unknown

options.text: "This all seems rather foreboding," stammers agoraphobic protester Harry Chapman. "If the Divine had wanted us to visit space, why is it so dark and inhospitable? There's nothing up there but creepy spiders from Mars. We must forbid all flying machines from the @@DEMONYM_ADJECTIVE@@ skies; only then will we be safe from the terrors of the air." [[color=blue]Airplanes are legal[/color]]
